idioms.meaning: to sew a fox's skin to the lion's
(with) great vigour (from the way splitting bamboo goes all down the stick)
Seven Sages of the Bamboo Grove

lessons.japanese: ドジャースは破竹の勢いで勝ち進んだ。
lessons.english: The Dodgers went on winning with irresistible force.

lessons.japanese: その竹はしなったが折れなかった。
lessons.english: The bamboo gave but did not break.

lessons.japanese: 竹内だけは招待に応じなかった。
lessons.english: Only Takeuchi didn't accept the invitation.
Bamboo stands out in the woods.

lessons.japanese: パンダは竹林にすんでいます。
竹が雪のおもみでたわんでいる。
lessons.english: The bamboo is bending with the weight of the snow.

lessons.japanese: 私たちは竹かごの作り方を教わった。
lessons.english: We received instructions on how to make a bamboo basket.

lessons.japanese: 厳密に言えば、竹は草の一種である。
lessons.english: Strictly speaking, bamboo is a kind of grass.
